summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

We have class CupertinoListTile: iOS-style list tile, equivalent to Material ListTile. It provides properties: leading, title, subtitle, trailing, additional_info, notched, padding, colors, on_click, url, etc. So summary: describes UI component for building iOS-like list items in Flet.

Business intent: Provide developers a ready-made iOS-styled list tile for creating interactive list entries with optional icons, text, additional info, click handling, navigation, etc., facilitating rapid UI development for iOS look-and-feel.

Keywords: iOS, list tile, Cupertino, UI component, leading icon, title, subtitle, trailing icon, click event, padding, background color, activation, navigation, Flet, cross-platform, material alternative.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Provide summary, business_intent, keywords list.

Return JSON object.

Let's craft.

Summary: "A UI control that renders an iOS‑style list item, similar to Material’s ListTile, allowing configuration of leading/trailing icons, title, subtitle, extra information, visual styling and interaction callbacks."

Business intent: "Enable developers to quickly add native‑looking iOS list entries to their Flet applications, handling taps, navigation and visual customization without manual layout code."

Keywords list: ["Cupertino", "list tile", "iOS style", "Flet", "UI component", "leading icon", "trailing icon", "title", "subtitle", "additional info", "click event", "background color", "navigation", "padding", "toggle inputs", "notched", "cross‑platform"].

Make sure JSON format with double quotes.

Return.
